Content: I'm about CCs calls, not sure about others - there was huge inconsistency on some point and if I remember correct James proposed/recommended to use everywhere strings

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: Maybe some args where only int is expecting can accept int, not sure

Author: dimxy#2587
Content:
I think this is because in this rpc call the rpc param client conversion feature in rpc/client.cpp is not used, so all params are considered as strings (and if needed, converted into numbers inside the rpc call. So for curl they are all strings).
As I can see most of our cc rpc calls do not use client conversion either. If they do we could pass number params as numbers. The methods that use this  are listed in client.cpp.
We may decide if we should use this conversion for all developers

Author: dimxy#2587
Content: Probably to make our docs consistent (where params are described as they are: number as numbers, strings as strings ) we should use the client conversion.

this will be quite annoying for the RPC wrapper developers, but once the wrappers are written, GUI devs wont have a problem.

Author: gcharang#6833
Content:
@Mylo 
as far as I observed, the cc related RPC have all args as strings
In the older (btc based  etc.,) ones args that are numbers don't need quotes
see second bullet in https://docs.komodoplatform.com/komodo/python-rpc-komodod.html#usage
as dimxy said
```
12:45 AM] dimxy: I think this is because in this rpc call the rpc param client conversion feature in rpc/client.cpp is not used, so all params are considered as strings (and if needed, converted into numbers inside the rpc call. So for curl they are all strings).
As I can see most of our cc rpc calls do not use client conversion either. If they do we could pass number params as numbers. The methods that use this  are listed in client.cpp.
We may decide if we should use this conversion for all developers
```

Content:
And there no any adjustment needed for `slick-rpc` client @gcharang since it's just usual client-server connection actually which wrap and send standartized JSON request and doing the same with response (it using pycurl and ujson).
Initially I just input rpcpassword, rpcuser and port and started to make calls - no any adjustments needed

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: Actually it should work with any btc fork which using quite standart config and request/response scheme

Author: TonyL#3577
Content:
`case 1` offer to buy tokens with price 0.08880000 each for 8.88000000 max, so totalrequired 100 tokens to fill this order (8.88000000 / 0.08880000 = 100)
`case 2` offer to sell 1000 tokens with 0.1111 price each so 0.11110000 * 1000 = 111.10000000
case3 is the same as case2

for buy you are actually 'selling' your coins for tokens that s why amount in coins
for sell you selling your tokens for  coins - amount in tokens

Author: akiii#2220
Content: Hi guys can anyone help me to create a non fungible

Author: akiii#2220
Content: I don‚Äôt find in the documentation how to do

Author: TonyL#3577
Content:
Hi @akiii 
https://developers.komodoplatform.com/basic-docs/customconsensus/tokens.html
Here you can find tokens documentation

Actually make NFT is very simple, all you need is to create a token with supply 1, for it you have to use 1 satoshi as input (second argument of tokencreate call):
```
./komodo-cli -ac_name=HELLOWORLD tokencreate MYTOKEN 0.00000001 "My very own NFT token."```

Author: akiii#2220
Content: @TonyL but if i want for example create 100 MYTOKEN but all different description it is possible ?

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: Yes, it's possible to create token with any supply/description you want. But in case of supply > 1 it'll be not NFT

Author: TonyL#3577
Content:
Just FYI, limitations are: 
32 symbols for token name
4096 for token description

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: So you can write metadata of NFT to description

Author: akiii#2220
Content: But for cryptokittie all character are a non fungible token

Author: akiii#2220
Content: But they can have the same name no ?

Author: akiii#2220
Content: With different power etc

Author: TonyL#3577
Content:
You can just write needed information to token description:
```./komodo-cli -ac_name=HELLOWORLD tokencreate KITTYTOKEN 0.00000001 "{
"type": "Catassin"
"name": "Meow Killa",
"srength": 21,
"superpower": "fluffy"
}
"```

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: And you can create as many KITTYTOKEN NFT as your dapp need

Author: akiii#2220
Content: Oh okay

Author: akiii#2220
Content: And how can you extract this description ?

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: `tokencreate` call will generate transaction hex as output. After you broadcast it by `sendrawtransaction hex` you'll get transaction id (we can call it token id)

Author: TonyL#3577
Content:
And then you'll able to check information as:
`./komodo-cli -ac_name=HELLOWORLD tokeninfo tokenid`

Author: TonyL#3577
Content:
And you'll see something like a:
```
./komodo-cli -ac_name=HELLOWORLD tokeninfo 43850dfce744581ef44775086625745adecd628993c5ff4c1c786cfd21009add

{
  "result": "success",
  "tokenid": "43850dfce744581ef44775086625745adecd628993c5ff4c1c786cfd21009add",
  "owner": "03fe754763c176e1339a3f62ee6b9484720e17ee4646b65a119e9f6370c7004abc",
  "name": "KITTYTOKEN",
  "supply": "1",
  "description": "{
"type": "Catassin"
"name": "Meow Killa",
"srength": 21,
"superpower": "fluffy"
}"
}
```

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: Then your app lets say can parse value of description key as you need

Author: akiii#2220
Content: Okay

Author: akiii#2220
Content: But how to terminal i can extract this

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: Not sure if I get your question. Could you please clarify?

Author: akiii#2220
Content: For example i create a dapp like cryptokittie how when a user grab a character i can show him the data of this character

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: Issue `tokeninfo` rpc call request with tokenid as argument, and show player needed data from response

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: In documentation which I shared above you can find curl examples

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: Exact implementation of interaction with RPC (we can call it blockchain API) depends of language which you'll use in your application

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: upd: Sorry for confusion, there is no curl examples in doc above

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: ```curl --user myrpcuser:myrpcpassword --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "tokeninfo", "params": ["43850dfce744581ef44775086625745adecd628993c5ff4c1c786cfd21009add"] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:myrpcport/```

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: So here it is üòÉ

Content: Okay thank you very much for your help

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: You're most welcome! It's actually very easy to use tokensCC for NFTs in-app creation, please feel free to clarify if you'll have more questions
